intro: Borreria strictissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Borreria strictissima is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
